intro: Deinbollia pervillei f. ankaranensis, commonly known as the Ankaranensis variant of the genus Deinbollia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its woody structure and simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a slight fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
